nodes.bodyText: Do you think it's helpful for a user to talk of assertion chains and predicates here? So something along the lines of Add a message to this assertion chain before the predicate method. I am imagining that users could be confused when they are supposed to add a message to this assertion but before 'this method', because they may think that this method is the assertion. For me, things got a lot easier to keep track of when we started to speak about chains, predicates and subjects.
Yes, make sense, we introduced this vocabulary exactly to improve the clarity, we should stick to it.
